page.title: 01Round the Ridgeway
page.content: Gentle undulating country, comprising arable, grassland with sheep and dairy farms and mixed woods. The population is mainy in three small villages, two situated along the ridgeway the third Coughton has an 150 yr old school and many old buildings and houses. The Ridgeway is a ridge at 120ft above sea level which also forms the Warwickshire Worcestershire border, and the highest point in the area. Two busy main roads dissect the area, one following the Ridgeway, the other follows a small brook in the valley which has its source in a wood along the Ridgeway. Numerous footpaths and two bridleways go between woods and farm land and away from the main roads the countryside offers a haven for wildlife including deer, badgers and a barn owl.
